about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.

comment.text: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
Pedestrian crossing ahead.
Pedestrians must not cross here.
Pedestrian crossing ahead.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

comment.text: This sign means: | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?

about.name: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?

hasPart.assesses: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do? | You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

suggestedAnswer.text: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.

comment.text: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

comment.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

suggestedAnswer.text: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

comment.text: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

acceptedAnswer.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

comment.text: Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

answerExplanation.text: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

comment.text: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do? | Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

hasPart.text: When being passed, you must yield to the passing vehicle and not increase your speed. Allow the vehicle to safely merge back into your lane.

comment.text: Brake hard.
Maintain a constant speed.
Speed up.
Maintain a constant speed.

answerExplanation.text: When being passed, you must yield to the passing vehicle and not increase your speed. Allow the vehicle to safely merge back into your lane.

hasPart.text: To drive quickly, pass, or turn left, use the left lane. Use the right lane when driving more slowly than surrounding traffic, entering the road, or turning right.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay in your lane so you don't impede the flow of traffic.

comment.text: Stay in your lane so you don't impede the flow of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive onto the left shoulder to let the other vehicles pass.

comment.text: Drive onto the left shoulder to let the other vehicles pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: Move into the right lane when it is safe.

comment.text: Move into the right lane when it is safe.

acceptedAnswer.text: Move into the right lane when it is safe.

comment.text: Move into the right lane when it is safe.

answerExplanation.text: To drive quickly, pass, or turn left, use the left lane. Use the right lane when driving more slowly than surrounding traffic, entering the road, or turning right.

comment.text: There are two traffic lanes moving in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right. Reduction in lanes.

hasPart.name: Yellow lines separate:
hasPart.assesses: Yellow lines separate: | Yellow lines separate: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.

comment.text: Traffic lanes on one-way streets.

suggestedAnswer.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

comment.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

suggestedAnswer.text: All carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes.

comment.text: All carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes.

acceptedAnswer.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

comment.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

answerExplanation.text: Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.

comment.text: Yellow lines separate: | Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.
